alert.note: Alert for Madison (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 11:58AM CST until February 08 at 3:40PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Crawford, Franklin, Madison, Sebastian and Washington AR. In Oklahoma, Adair, Haskell, Latimer and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1157 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated areas of moderate to occasionally heavy rain. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Stilwell... Ozark... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Alma... Muldrow... Roland... West Fork... Arkoma... Mulberry... Dyer... Altus... Keota... Red Oak... Mccurtain... Winslow... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
